meanings.definition: A type of material made from compressed wood fibers.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used fiberboard to build the shelves in the garage.
meanings.sent2: The fiberboard was lightweight and easy to cut for the project.
meanings.sent3: When the fiberboard started telling jokes, everyone laughed at its wooden humor.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like fiberboard, strong and sturdy, yet flexible when needed.
meanings.sent5: The texture of the fiberboard felt rough and grainy, like a miniature forest under her fingertips.

meanings.definition: A board made from wood or other fibers, used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The new house was built with fiberboard to ensure durability.
meanings.sent2: She painted the fiberboard a bright white to match the trim of the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat used the fiberboard as a scratching post, much to the owner's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The fiberboard walls echoed with the sounds of construction, a symphony of progress.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh pine filled the room, emanating from the fiberboard walls like a forest in bloom.
